answers.answer: I can't help you with the diabetes portion, but I am finding out the down feeling is actually common at this point. I am actually going to talk to my dr about starting an anti depressant now I am 38 weeks. That way I will be ready for the postpartum portion afterwards. Keep the lines of communication with your medical professional open about it. Never know how they can help.
I will for sure. I had post partum with my first. Was hard that's for sure.

question: Im 34 weeks today and was borderline gestational diabetic. On June 20 I finally went to a diabetic clinic and then this past tues I was put on insulin. since then my doses have been put up. Just can't seem to get my before meal numbers down and my morning after meal numbers down. It's making me a lil down. Especially today. Has anyone else had trouble controlling their levels and if so how long did it take to get on track?
title: not really a question... feeling down.
